metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Git Install
How to Install Git
You can download Git for free from git-scm.com .
content.html: You can download Git for free from git-scm.com.

content.text: After installation, you will be able to use Git from your terminal or command prompt.
content.html: After installation, you will be able to use Git from your terminal or command prompt.

content.text: Tip for Beginners: Installing Git is safe and you can always uninstall it later if you want.
content.html: Tip for Beginners: Installing Git is safe and you can always uninstall it later if you want.

content.text: Git Bash
Git Bash is a terminal for Windows that lets you use Git commands.
content.html: Git Bash is a terminal for Windows that lets you use Git commands.

content.text: Look at our Bash Tutorial to learn more about Bash.
content.html: Look at our Bash Tutorial to learn more about Bash.

content.text: After installing Git, you can find Git Bash in your Start menu.
content.html: After installing Git, you can find Git Bash in your Start menu.

content.text: You can use Git Bash just like the Command Prompt, but with extra Unix commands (like ls and pwd ).
content.html: You can use Git Bash just like the Command Prompt, but with extra Unix commands (like ls and pwd).

content.text: Example: Open Git Bash
Click Start, type "Git Bash", and open the app.
content.html: Click Start, type "Git Bash", and open the app.

content.code_html:
ls
Desktop  Documents  Downloads  Pictures

content.text: Verifying Your Installation
After installing, check that Git works by opening your terminal (or Git Bash on Windows) and running:
content.html: After installing, check that Git works by opening your terminal (or Git Bash on Windows) and running:

content.code_html:
git --version
git version 2.43.0.windows.1

content.text: If Git is installed, you will see something like git version X.Y.Z
content.html: If Git is installed, you will see something like git version X.Y.Z

content.text: If you see an error, try closing and reopening your terminal, or check that Git is in your PATH.
content.html: If you see an error, try closing and reopening your terminal, or check that Git is in your PATH.

content.text: Default Editor
During installation, Git asks you to pick a default text editor.
content.html: During installation, Git asks you to pick a default text editor.

content.text: This is the program that will open when you need to write messages (like for commits).
content.html: This is the program that will open when you need to write messages (like for commits).

content.code_html: git config --global core.editor "code --wait"

content.text: If you're not sure, just pick the default (Notepad on Windows). You can always change this later.
content.html: If you're not sure, just pick the default (Notepad on Windows). You can always change this later.

content.code_html: git config --global core.editor "notepad"

content.text: PATH Environment
Choosing to add Git to your PATH means you can use Git commands in any terminal window.
content.html: Choosing to add Git to your PATH means you can use Git commands in any terminal window.

content.text: This is highly recommended for most users to do this during installation.
content.html: This is highly recommended for most users to do this during installation.

content.text: If you skip this, you'll only be able to use Git in Git Bash (on Windows) or Terminal (on macOS and Linux).
content.html: If you skip this, you'll only be able to use Git in Git Bash (on Windows) or Terminal (on macOS and Linux).

content.code_html:
git --version
git version 2.43.0.windows.1

content.text: If you see an error, you need to add Git to your PATH.
content.html: If you see an error, you need to add Git to your PATH.

content.text: How to Add Git to PATH after Installation
After adding Git to your PATH, open a new terminal window and run git --version to check that it works everywhere.
content.html: After adding Git to your PATH, open a new terminal window and run git --version to check that it works everywhere.

content.text: Line Endings
Git can convert line endings in text files.
content.html: Git can convert line endings in text files.

content.text: On Windows, it's usually best to select "Checkout Windows-style, commit Unix-style line endings".
content.html: On Windows, it's usually best to select "Checkout Windows-style, commit Unix-style line endings".

content.text: This helps prevent problems when you share code with people using different operating systems.
content.html: This helps prevent problems when you share code with people using different operating systems.

content.text: Updating or Uninstalling Git
Troubleshooting Git Installation
If you run into problems installing or running Git, don't worry!
content.html: If you run into problems installing or running Git, don't worry!

content.text: Here are solutions to some of the most common issues.
content.html: Here are solutions to some of the most common issues.

content.text: Tip: If something doesn't work right away, try closing and reopening your terminal, or restarting your computer.
content.html: Tip: If something doesn't work right away, try closing and reopening your terminal, or restarting your computer.
